reviewText: This is a charming and engaging continuation of the GREEK story. This series continues to be lighthearted and a joy to watch. My only minor complaint is that the picture quality of this upscaled DVD could be better when being watched on a high definition (1080p) television.I recommend that you buy this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Those loveable twentysomethings are back in Chapter Two, still trying to find their way in the world and enjoy themselves while they do it.After Jen K's expose, Nationals comes down hard on the Greek system, but none harder than ZBZ. Frannie is removed from her position as president, and Casey is surprisingly placed as the interim. Kappa Tau is trying to find a way to keep the party alive even underneath the restrictions, and lend a helping hand to the disgraced ZBZs. Omega Chi try to remain the good guys on the outside, but on the inside they keep the rivalry with Kappa Tau as hot as ever, and Evan ends up playing more of an antagonistic role. During this chapter the pasts of Casey, Cappie, and Evan are revealed, including how she started a night with one of the boys and ended it with the other. The season comes to a close during Spring Break in Myrtle Beach, where plenty of secrets are revealed, relationships and alliances are formed, and everyone succumbs to the heat one way or another.This chapter includes the episodes...A New NormalThe Great CappieHighway To The Discomfort ZoneWar and PeaceFreshman DazeMove On. Cartwrights47 Hours & 11 MinutesMister Purr-fectNo Campus for Old RulesA Tale of Two PartiesBarely LegalSpring Broke...along with some special features, such as a Plain White T's music video and bloopers. What are you waiting for? Pledge today!

reviewText: After an article written by a ZBZ pledge, the Greek system is under scrutiny, and parties and fun now has to be hidden from faculty and professors. But that doesn't stop the ultimate party house, Kappa Tau from having the best time of any fraternity on campus.This season starts from Rusty's second semester of Freshman year, and ends at Spring Break.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love all the characters in Greek, even the ones we're supposed to hate. That's it how well they are developed in my opinion. Do I like more the fraternity system? Certainly not, I will never understand why someone would like to be part of this. But, the show is well writen,and the relationships between the characters believable. That is what matters to me when I watch a film or a series, and the Greek characters made me care about them.
